title: Rehabilitation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at John Muir Health (Pleasant Hill, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Started with a tour, short interview with the interviewer who was a current therapist there and then I was directed to follow an aide to see what their duties were.

I say the interview experience was negative because the interviewer did not talk about the job position at all. I was asked general questions listed below and then they left. For information about the job itself, I had to ask the aide I was told to follow. Speaking with the workers there was a positive experience. The aides showed me what they do in their day and what I would be doing. They also gave me a lot of insight on the work culture of the place, how productive they are expected to be and how busy it can get. 

When the aide guided back to the interviewer, they were in their office on browsing on their phone. After the fact, the interviewer just gave me her card and said I could send her references and went back to her office without saying anything else. Even after sending her multiple references, I did not get a response back from her. I did get an automated rejection letter weeks later however.
Interview Questions: The questions asked were mainly general ones. (EX: Describe yourself, Tell me about yourself, Tell me about a time you... Why should we hire you? What makes you stand out from others? etc.)

title: Director Information Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at John Muir Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online in early March 2021, received a screening email from internal recruiter 17 days later. Submitted response, and received rejection email eight days later. 

Note this is for the role “Director-Information Security - IT Security CISO”. Wait, you have the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) at a director level? And can not be bothered to have a conversation, rather just have a pre-canned question/response via email? 

Note that John Muir Health was advertising for a CISO in fall of 2013, with previous CISOs since that time being at the VP level. With this sort of approach to finding a new leader of their Information Security program, and the demotion of the role, it brings the question as to why does John Muir Health not appreciate the business value of their Information Security business risk management program?
Interview Questions: Please provide your salary expectation.

title: Administrative Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at John Muir Health (Walnut Creek, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
After completing my online application, I was contacted by a professional and friendly HR employee to set up an initial phone interview.  The phone interview, conducted by an HR Business Partner, lasted for about 45-minutes - we spoke about my knowledge base and the details of the position; this interview was refreshing in that I knew I was speaking with a professional - I felt we covered a lot of ground.   The next step involved 2 in-person interviews, with the hiring manager and another  HR Business Partner.  Welcoming and professional interviews, it was as though we had worked with each other before, a genuine sharing of best HR practices as well as common business interests.  After this, I was invited to an extensive panel interview with 5 HR professionals.  Following the panel interview, I was asked to meet with the Sr. VP of HR and the HR Manager of Employee Relations, at the corporate Administrative offices.  The interview process took 4-weeks.  An offer of employment was made, contingent upon a satisfactory, full background check and physical.  

To be completely transparent to those who apply to JMH, the interview process was absolutely, without a doubt, the most comprehensive, yet friendly and professional process I have been through - in any organization.  Every individual exemplified compassion, a love for their employer's mission and the work they do... and, I always felt that I was being invited into a warm and caring family, each step along the way.  Though the interviews were extensive and challenging, I was always treated with courtesy and the utmost respect.
Interview Questions: A lot of knowledge-based questions, to determine my HR experience.

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at John Muir Health (Walnut Creek, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was excited to be called back for a second interview with the hiring manager.  The second interview included a skills test & a meeting with other staff members.  I thought it went well & when I left she indicated they were just looking for the right fit & would get back to us within a week or two.  I sent thank you notes and a follow-up note, but was never contacted again.  I assume they hired another candidate, but I think it is unprofessional and disrespectful that they did not, at least send a "thanks, but no thanks" note.
Interview Questions: Nothing really unusual.  Behavioral question: how would you handle a situation where you were busy with closing the books and someone had an urgent ad hoc request?  There was also a basic accounting test.

title: E R Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at John Muir Health (Walnut Creek, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: A great interview and was treated very professional
Interview Questions: What is my feeling of the up and coming Obama care?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at John Muir Health
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. A recruiter will contact you and ask generalized questions about yourself and experience. Then if selected, you will meet with three members of the department for three 30 minute interviews. You may also meet with the VP of finance and the VP of revenue and the VP of analytics.   If they move forward with you, you will speak to a hiring manager. finally you will be offered the job roughly two weeks after the previous interview.  Entire process can take up to 2 months so be patient
Interview Questions: Describing ways to implement cost reducing activities in the healthcare industry in general, in addition to the comapny

title: Medical Assistant for Physician's Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at John Muir Health (Walnut Creek, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I didn't quite make it to the interview section as I failed the skills test. The test that I took (there are two separate tests that you could take) consisted of questions regarding needle size, EKG lead placement, some medical definitions, and a few questions on certain diseases. (The EKG questions got me...I have not done one in years! Yikes). You are allowed to get 4 wrong out of 20 in order to pass. You take the test in the waiting room and if you fail you can re try right then and there or reschedule the test. If you retake it there you are excused and cannot re apply for 6 months.
Interview Questions: Where are EKG leads placed (not the exact question, but pretty close)?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at John Muir Health in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: There is an initial interview with HR, if this is passed, then the next level is with the manager. The job offer comes from the HR department. Expect a two week minimum process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at John Muir Health in Jun 2007
Interview Descriptions: I basically walked in with my qualifications, spoke to HR and she sent me to the hiring management on my floor.  I was immediately offered the job and I accepted the position the same day.  I started work within 3 weeks. But, the interviewer must bear in mind that I went through this process 4 years ago.  The market for nurses is much different now.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for your future if you are hired in this position, are you anticipating changing departments quickly?
